channel.title: Port Forwarding?
channel.description:
Hello, i am having alot of trouble finding a tutorial for Port Forwarding that i can understand.. i have found a few but they dont have same modem as me so if you could help me out here you will be REWARDED
[IMG]http://i213.photobucket.com/albums/cc147/jessen_yeah/PortForward.jpg[/img]
Could you tell me what to fill in and where to fill it in Thanks[br][size=1]Posted on: August 22, 2007, 04:11:28 AM[/size][hr]RS CASH REWARDED

item.title: Port Forwarding?
item.dc:creator: @Breaking_Shadow Breaking_Shadow
item.description:
@Breaking_Shadow wrote:

You should use no-ip.com for port forwarding, like what i do. If you do that, i might be able to help you since i also used port forwarding for my own server.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding?
item.dc:creator: @Steviie Steviie
item.description:
@Steviie wrote:

If you go to >Start >Run and type ‘CMD’ then hit enter, you will see a box appear. Then, in the box, type ‘IPCONFIG’.
Hit enter. IP’s should come up, about 3. Look at ‘IP Address’ it should be something like 192.168...

Hm, for the connection put your connection.

Application - Maybe just any name?

Source IP Address - (first thing i said)

Destination IP Address - (same thing) (or your computers ip address)

Port Start - Probably 43594

Port Map - Probably 43594

-Just have a fiddle around with the IP’s.

Read full topic
